alert.note: Alert for Pima (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 17 at 8:10PM MST until August 17 at 9:30PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of South Central Arizona, including the following county, Pima. * WHEN...Until 930 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 805 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms across north central Pima county, especially near Picture Rock and Silverbell. This will cause small stream flooding, especially in normally dry washes that fill into the Brawley, Los Robles and Blanco Washes. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Mammoth Wash, Tiro Wash, El, Cocio Wash, Blanco Wash, Pan Tak Wash, House Wash, San Vicente Wash, Los Robles Wash, Viopuli Wash, Santa Cruz River, Anegan Wash, Brawley Wash and Aguirre Wash. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tucson, Marana, Avra Valley, Saguaro National Park West, Tucson Estates, Picture Rocks, Queens Well, Santa Rosa Ranch and Silver Bell. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
